DataElement.preferredName: Patient ROS1 Gene Translocation Inversion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of whether a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study based on the patient being positive for translocation or inversion events involving the ROS1 gene.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient ROS1 Gene Translocation Inversion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to translocation or inversion events involving the ROS1 as an element of the personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: ROS1 Gene Translocation Inversion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in receptor tyrosine phosphorylation signal transduction, and is thought to play a role in cellular growth or differentiation, but an exact function has not been substantiated.:The movement of a physical object from one place to another. (NCI):The act of turning inside out, upside down, or end-for-end.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in receptor tyrosine phosphorylation signal transduction, and is thought to play a role in cellular growth or differentiation, but an exact function has not been substantiated.
The movement of a physical object from one place to another. (NCI)
The act of turning inside out, upside down, or end-for-end.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patients must be positive for
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must be positive for translocation or inversion events involving the ROS1 gene as detected on the MATCH NGS assay
